intro: Kadua tryblium, commonly known as the Hawaiian false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Kadua tryblium is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii and plays a role in the local ecosystem.
